intro: Pimpinella edosmioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbel-shaped flower clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent, while its flowers range from white to pale yellow. It is a relatively small plant, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters, and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
